    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(int i,
              java.lang.String n,
              int p,
              int b,
              int w,
              boolean jb,
              int jc,
              int jCount,
              boolean a,
              boolean t)
        Constructor for all Player objects
        Parameters:
        i - an integer storing player's ID
        n - a String storing the player's name
        p - an integer storing the player's position
        b - an integer storing the player's liquid cash
        w - an integer storing the player's total wealth
        jb - a boolean storing the player's jail status
        jc - an integer storing the quantity of Get out of Jail Free cards possessed by the player
        jCount - an int value to define how long the player has been in jail
        a - a boolean recording if the player is active in the current game
        t - a boolean recording if it is the players turn or not

      • calcWealth

        public void calcWealth()
        Calculates the player's wealth by finding all of the player's assets and stores their summed value. This method includes mortgaged properties within the wealth

      • calcUnmortWealth

        public int calcUnmortWealth()
        Requests for the player's wealth to be calculated and then subtracts the value of all mortgaged properties
        Returns:
        int value of the player's wealth minus the value of all the player's mortgaged properties

      • getWealth

        public int getWealth()
        First calculates the wealth of the player and then returns the calculated wealth
        Returns:
        calculate wealth of the player as an int

      • setWealth

        public void setWealth(int w)
        Defines a new wealth for the player. Does not request for the wealth to be calculated
        Parameters:
        w - int value in which to set the players cumulative wealth

      • isJail

        public boolean isJail()
        Returns jailBool which stores the player's jail status: true=jailed, false=not jailed
        Returns:
        boolean declaring the state of the player's jail status.

      • setJail

        public void setJail(boolean j)
        Sets the boolean value storing the player's jail status: true=jailed, false=not jailed
